ygData.subject: RE: Norrathian Lore: Nagafen's Lair (was: Archmage Answ ers)
ygData.msgSnippet: yeah great idea, I ve never been in sola at all...and while you re at it, see if you can get  shot of pokeman for me. ;-) Faras
ygData.messageBody:
yeah great idea, I've never been in sola at all...and while you're at it,
see if you can get shot of pokeman for me. ;-)

Faras

> -----Original Message-----
> From: LeiaOrgana [mailto:LEIAORGANA@...]
> Sent: Friday, February 04, 2000 10:33 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Norrathian Lore: Nagafen's Lair (was: Archmage
> Answers)
>
>
> From: "LeiaOrgana" <LEIAORGANA@...>
>
> Unfortunately for me I've never noticed the artwork. Hmmmm.
> Pretty bad for
> an art minor. The only one I remember is the poker playing
> one. I think
> this would be really great. Please get snapping!
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>
> To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
> Sent: Friday, February 04, 2000 11:40 AM
> Subject: [eqbards] Norrathian Lore: Nagafen's Lair (was:
> Archmage Answers)
>
>
> > From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>
> >
> > > So, now we have been playing this game for nearly a year.
> Does anyone
> have
> > > a clue about the actual "lore" of Norrath? What have
> they done to tell
> us
> > > some history?
> >
> > /ooc
> >
> > On my lunch break today, I will run from innothule to solb.
> > I will snap pictures of all the paintings on the walls for us
> > to discuss. If you have not examined the pictures which are
> > pasted across the zone, you are really missing out.
> >
> > /ic, mostly.
> >
> > I will be entering Nagafen's Lair, visiting the King room
> > (king, priest, champ) - and nearby areas to record information
> > as to the meaning behind the art. I've brought this up before
> > and I love listening to people's take on what it really means.
> > I've started conversations with group members in the king room
> > which have lasted hours about the meaning behind the pantings.
> >
> > After we talk about the various meanings, I would like to submit
> > the pictures and comments onto a website which we can ask Verant
> > to look at and maybe /chuckle at; then give us the 'real' intent
> > or meaning behind the scenes. There is a story afoot,
> and I'd like
> > to know what that story is.
> >
> > It would be in the true spirit of bards to want to pursue such
> > storytelling in the future.
> >
> > Harmonic.
> >
> >
